intro: Urostigma backhousei, commonly known as the Natal grass or Natal flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. Urostigma backhousei plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
